question.title: Remove Consecutive Duplicates
question.content:
For a given string(str), remove all the consecutive duplicate characters.

Example:
Input String: "aaaa"
Expected Output: "a"

Input String: "aabbbcc"
Expected Output: "abc"
 Input Format:
The first and only line of input contains a string without any leading and trailing spaces. All the characters in the string would be in lower case.
Output Format:
The only line of output prints the updated string.

You are not required to print anything. It has already been taken care of.
Constraints:
0 <= N <= 10^6
Where N is the length of the input string.

Time Limit: 1 second
Sample Input 1:
aabccbaa
Sample Output 1:
abcba
Sample Input 2:
xxyyzxx
Sample Output 2:
xyzx

rephrased.body: Given a string, remove all consecutive duplicate characters from it.
constraints: 0 <= N <= 10^6, where N is the length of the input string.
The input string consists of lowercase characters only.

testcases.explanation: The consecutive duplicate 'a's are reduced to a single 'a'.
Consecutive duplicate 'a's are reduced to 'a', 'b's to 'b', and 'c's to 'c'.
The string becomes 'abcbaa' after removing the first set of duplicates, then 'abcba' after removing the duplicates in 'aa'.
No consecutive duplicates, so the string remains unchanged.
An empty string remains an empty string.
Removing consecutive a's and b's results in the output 'babab'
